byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and MITCH SMITH

abstract: Prominent black leaders in Chicago call for investigations into city's Police Dept after release of video showing white Officer Jason Van Dyke shooting black teenager Laquan McDonald 16 times; demands, along with those for resignation of Police Superintendent Garry F McCarthy, reflect longstanding tensions and distrust between city's black community and its police force.
lead_paragraph: Some of Chicago’s most prominent black leaders called for a Justice Department investigation into the police department and its handling of a shooting of a black teenager by a white officer last year.

headline.main: Black Leaders in Chicago Push for Investigation of Police Department
headline.print_headline: Black Leaders in Chicago Push for Investigation of Police Department
